specific_topics.description: Interpreting trends, slopes, and relationships in line graphs; identifying direct and inverse relationships
Comparing quantities across categories, analyzing distributions, identifying patterns in grouped data
Analyzing relationships between variables, identifying correlation strength and direction
Interpreting graphs with multiple dependent or independent variables, understanding complex relationships
Predicting values within and beyond given data points, understanding limitations of predictions
Identifying trends and patterns in tabulated data, recognizing relationships across rows and columns
Understanding mathematical relationships between values, calculating ratios and proportions
Analyzing how changes in one variable affect others, identifying dependent and independent variables
Comparing values across different conditions or trials, identifying similarities and differences
Converting between different units of measurement, understanding unit relationships
Interpreting labeled diagrams of scientific equipment, processes, or systems
Understanding laboratory apparatus arrangements and experimental configurations
Following sequential steps in scientific processes, understanding cause and effect relationships
Understanding scientific models, diagrams, and their representations of real phenomena
Understanding scale factors, proportions, and measurements in scientific diagrams
Identifying and understanding the purpose of controlled variables in experiments
Recognizing variables being manipulated by researchers in experiments
Identifying measured outcomes and understanding how they respond to changes
Understanding control groups and their role in experimental validity
Analyzing the selection and size of experimental groups and their impact on results
Understanding methods used to collect scientific data and their limitations
Analyzing how data is recorded, organized, and documented in experiments
Identifying sources of experimental error and their impact on results
Understanding the difference between precise and accurate measurements
Analyzing different approaches to collecting representative samples
Identifying patterns and trends in experimental results
Understanding basic statistical concepts and their application to data
Determining relationships between variables and experimental outcomes
Evaluating the impact of errors on experimental conclusions
Drawing valid conclusions from experimental data and observations
Analyzing different explanations for scientific phenomena
Assessing the strength of evidence supporting different theories
Recognizing underlying assumptions in different scientific theories
Comparing predictions made by different scientific models or theories
Evaluating the advantages and limitations of different scientific models
Analyzing evidence used to support scientific claims and arguments
Understanding opposing viewpoints and their supporting evidence
Evaluating how experimental results support different theories
Analyzing the logic and validity of scientific arguments
Assessing whether conclusions are supported by available evidence
